title: Emergency Remote Teaching (ERT) Assessment Competency Enhancement Program: Blended Research Methods-Based Mathematics Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Effectiveness analysis and improvement strategies using ERT assessment tools in workplace mathematics education programs

learning_goals: Learners can design quantitative and qualitative assessment tools in an emergency remote teaching (ERT) environment to measure mathematics education effectiveness.
Learners can analyze the local applicability of ERT implementation principles (simplicity, accessibility, affordability, flexibility, empathy) by applying mixed research methods.

Learners will analyze case studies from at least three regions in Indonesia, propose one ERT (Emergency Remote Teaching) math education model suitable for developing countriesâ€™ educational environments (low-income/low-tech conditions), and design a proposal meeting at least two of three evaluation criteria (educational effectiveness, feasibility, cost-efficiency).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
